title: Ritz-Carlton Marina del Rey fetes 25 years with ’90s bash
text:
September 24, 2015 Ritz-Carlton Marina del Rey 
The Ritz-Carlton, Marina del Rey, CA, is toasting its 25th anniversary with a celebration that takes guests back to the 1990s. 
From time capsules including artifacts from the decade to a special event in the lobby on its anniversary on Oct. 15, complete with a ‘90s soundtrack, guests will be able to participate and help look back on the property’s history. As the hotel plans to undergo another facelift in the form of guest room renovations, this may spur travel plans for regulars looking to experience the hotel as-is one last time. 
Party like it’s 1990 For a week leading up to Oct. 15, the date of the hotel’s anniversary, consumers can book a luxury room package. Priced at $2,500, the offer includes a two-night stay in an executive suite, a prix fixe dinner and a time capsule containing mementos of the 1990s. 
On Oct. 15, the hotel will encourage guests and visitors to join in the fun. A backdrop spread alongside the entrance will encourage selfies from attendees, who will be prompted to share the results on social media with the brand-wide hashtag #RCMemories. 
Once inside, guests will be treated to cake pops and Champagne as they enjoy a soundtrack of ‘90s tunes. Ritz-Carlton will test their knowledge of the decade with a questionnaire, which will enter consumers into a contest for a 25 percent discount on logoed items in the gift shop. 
Outdoors at Ritz-Carlton Marina del Rey 
Through the month of October, guests who book 60-minute or longer spa treatments will receive $25 off. 
Beyond joining together locals and travelers, this celebration is also for the hotel employees, 13 of whom have been with the property since the beginning. 
“This is a time when we celebrate those who have been here since our opening, and embrace the culture of The Ritz-Carlton and what it has meant to each and every lady or gentleman that has made an impact throughout our day-to-day operations,” said Tony Mira, the hotel’s general manager, in a statement. “We look forward to what the next quarter-century brings us in the ever-changing industry where we are proud to be leaders.” 
Hotels commonly celebrate their anniversaries by giving their properties a new look. Peninsula Hotel Hong Kong celebrated its 85th anniversary in 2013 with a gala evening that featured work from Hong Kong artist Lee Chi Ching. The celebration was imbued with additional significance because the property completed a $58 million room enhancement project earlier in the year. Anniversary celebrations not only impart a sense of credibility, but also provide hotels with a jumping-off point for numerous campaigns ( see story ).
